newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-HIH says '97 profit outlook very good.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-HIH says '97 profit outlook very good.

text.p: Insurance firm HIH Winterthur International Ltd said on Monday the profit outlook in the 1997 calendar year was extremely positive and that it was assured of considerable premium growth.
"The outlook for 1997 is extremely positive," chief executive Ray Williams said in a statement accompanying the company's 1996 profit result.
"Considerable premium growth is assured and, subject to movements in investment markets, the earnings impetus will be maintained," Williams said.
HIH Winterthur is about 48 percent owned by Winterthur Swiss Insurance Company.
The company said its calendar 1996 net profit rose by 28 percent to A$61.5 million and it was now ranked as the second largest general insurer in Australia.

Gross earned premium rose by 44 percent in 1996 to A$1.346 billion and net earned premium rose by 46 percent to A$931.5 million. Investment income, excluding realised and unrealised capital movements, rose by 56 percent to A$96.1 million.
Williams said the company posted significant profit growth from a number of domestic operations and from its international portfolio, in particular the United Kingdom and New Zealand.
"This year will see benefits from a range of initiatives flow through and sustain the momentum," Williams said.

"Sizeable contributions are expected from the expansion of our Australian bancassurance activities (the National Australia Bank alliance comes on stream from 1 July), from the United Kingdom and from our recently re-acquired California workers compensation business," he said.
